description.narrative: Early Career Researchers, Higher Education Institutions, Research Organisations and freelance researchers.

Match funding (in kind) is provided by the partner universities in Jordan. Five Researcher Links Workshops are implemented. The Jordanian partner Universities are: The University of Jordan, Philadelphia University (two Researcher Links Workshops Projects), Jordan University of Science and Technology and University of Petra. UK Universities are: University of Portsmouth, University of Salford, University of Brighton (two Researcher Links Workshops Projects) and University of Wolverhampton.

Researcher Links Workshops: aim is to bring together early-career researchers from the UK and Jordan to allow them to make international connections that can improve the quality of their research. It will be focusing on building links for future collaboration and enhancing the researchers’ career opportunities, support international development and research, contribute to capacity building of early career researchers and establish new and strengthen existing research links. The Researchers Links Workshops priority areas in Jordan are: Energy; Water management; Agri-tech and food security; Cultural heritage; Bio-technology and bio-security and Nanotechnology.

The Newton Fund builds research and innovation partnerships with 17 active partner countries to support their economic development and social welfare, and to develop their research and innovation capacity for long-term sustainable growth. It has a total UK Government investment of £735 million up until 2021, with matched resources from the partner countries. The Newton Fund is managed by the UK Department for Business, Energy and Industrial Strategy (BEIS), and delivered through 7 UK delivery partners, which includes UK Research and Innovation (comprising the 7 research councils and Innovate UK), the UK Academies, the British Council and the Met Office. In Jordan it's known as Newton-Khalidi Fund. Under Newton-Khalidi Fund the particular programme offered is Researchers Links Workshops.
